DOC.brief_title: TOBY ( TOtal Body hYpothermia ) : Study Treatment Perinatal Asphyxia
DOC.detailed_description: This multicentre prospective randomise control trial determine whether reduction body temperature 3-4°C follow perinatal asphyxia improves survival without neurodevelopmental disability . Full term infant randomise within 6 hour birth either control group rectal temperature keep 37 ± 0.2°C whole body cool rectal temperature keep 33.5 ± 0.5°C 72 hour follow slow rewarming . The outcome assess 18 month age survival neurological neurodevelopmental testing . Eligibility criterion : Term infant less 6 hour birth moderate severe perinatal asphyxia ( combination clinical EEG criterion ) . Exclusion criterion : Infants expect 6 hour age time randomisation infant major congenital abnormality . Intervention : Intensive care whole body cool versus intensive care without whole body cooling ( baby cool 33.5°C 72 hour ) Main Outcomes : Death severe neurodevelopmental impairment 18 month age Secondary Outcomes : Cerebral thrombosis haemorrhage , persistent hypotension , pulmonary hypertension , abnormal coagulation , arrhythmia sepsis neonatal period . Neurological impairment 18 month Number patient require : 236 . On 30th November 2006 , recruitment close , 325 baby recruit .
